name: Automatisation du support alimentée par l'IA avec Outlook, OpenAI et la gestion des tickets JIRA
description:
## Ce flux de travail traite automatiquement les demandes de support client provenant d'e-mails et de formulaires web, utilise l'IA pour classer et soit résoudre automatiquement des problèmes simples, soit acheminer intelligemment des problèmes complexes vers les bons membres de l'équipe avec des tickets JIRA appropriés et un suivi des SLA.


### Avantages clés

- Support multicanal (e-mail + formulaires web)
- Acheminement intelligent vers des agents qualifiés en fonction de l'expertise
- Création de tickets cohérente avec le contexte complet dans JIRA


### Parfait pour

- Équipes de support gérant plus de 50 demandes/jour
- Entreprises SaaS avec un support client par niveaux
- Organisations souhaitant étendre le support sans embaucher
- Équipes ayant besoin d'une classification cohérente des tickets

### Exigences

Microsoft Outlook (surveillance des e-mails)
OpenAI API (classification par IA)
JIRA Cloud (gestion des tickets)
n8n instance avec nœuds IA

parameters.message:
Dear {{ $json.name }},

Your support request has been received and assigned ticket #{{ $json.ticketKey }}.

Priority: {{ $json.output.urgency }}{{ $json.output.isVIP ? ' (VIP)' : '' }}
Assigned to: {{ $json.assignedAgent }}
Expected response: {{ $json.slaHours }} hours

We'll update you as we work on your request.

Best regards,
Support Team
parameters.subject: Support Ticket Created - {{ $json.subject }}

messageValues.message:
Classify this support request. Return JSON with:
{
  "category": "technical|billing|account|feature",
  "urgency": "critical|high|medium|low",
  "expertise": "frontend|backend|support|business",
  "canAutoResolve": true|false,
  "isVIP": true|false
}

VIP indicators: enterprise email domains, mentions of "enterprise", "premium", urgent language.
Auto-resolve: simple how-to questions, password resets, basic billing questions.

parameters.content:
## SMART SUPPORT AGENT

This workflow handles support requests from:
- Outlook emails (shared inbox)
- Web forms (webhook endpoint)

### KEY FEATURES:
✅ AI-powered classification
✅ Auto-resolution for simple issues
✅ Smart agent routing
✅ SLA tracking

### CUSTOMIZE FOR YOUR TEAM

STEP 1: Update "Assign Agent" node
→ Edit function code
→ Replace email addresses with your team

STEP 2: Modify JIRA settings
→ "Create JIRA Ticket" node
→ Change project key from "SUP"
→ Update issue types if needed

STEP 3: Adjust SLA times
→ In "Assign Agent" function
→ Modify slaHours object values

STEP 4: Test webhook endpoint
→ https://your-n8n.com/webhook/support

### AI CLASSIFICATION TIPS

The AI determines:
- Category (technical/billing/account/feature)
- Urgency (critical/high/medium/low) 
- Who should handle it
- If it can be auto-resolved

TO IMPROVE ACCURACY:
→ Add examples to the prompt
→ Include your product-specific terms
→ Train with your actual tickets

VIP DETECTION:
Currently looks for enterprise domains
→ Customize in the prompt!

### AUTO-RESOLUTION WORKS FOR:

✅ Password reset requests
✅ "Where is my invoice?" 
✅ Basic how-to questions
✅ Documentation requests
✅ Simple account questions

### NEVER AUTO-RESOLVES:
- Billing disputes
- Security issues  
- Bug reports
- VIP customer requests
- Complex technical problems

CUSTOMIZE: Edit the AI prompt to match your support patterns!

### WEBHOOK INTEGRATION

ENDPOINT: /webhook/support
METHOD: POST

REQUIRED FIELDS:
{
  "email": "customer@company.com",
  "name": "Customer Name", 
  "message": "Support request text"
}

OPTIONAL FIELDS:
{
  "subject": "Custom subject",
  "priority": "high",
  "source": "website"
}

INTEGRATE WITH:
- Contact forms
- Chat widgets
- Mobile apps
- Other systems

Returns: {"status":"success", "ticketId":"..."}

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
